Class Grundy2RecPerdEtGagn

java.lang.Object
Grundy2RecPerdEtGagn
class Grundy2RecPerdEtGagn extends Object
Grundy2 Game This class adds storage of winning heaps

    • enlever

      void enlever(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, int nb)
      Divide the matches of a line of play into two heaps (1 line = 1 heap)
      Parameters:
      jeu - table of matches by line
      ligne - line (heap) on which matches should be separated
      nb - number of matches REMOVED from line after separation

    • estPossible

      boolean estPossible(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Tests if it's possible to separate a heap
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is at least a heap of 3 or more matches, false otherwise

    • premier

      int premier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai)
      Create a very first trial configuration from the game
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - new game configuration
      Returns:
      the number of the heap divided in half or -1 if there is no heap of at least 3 matches

    • suivant

      int suivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne)
      Generates the following test setup (i.e. ONE possible decomposition)
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - play test configuration after separation
      ligne - the number of the heap which is the last to have been separated
      Returns:
      the number of the heap divided in two for the new configuration, -1 if no more decomposition is possible

      void testCasSuivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> resJeu, int resLigne)
      Test a case of the suivant method
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - the game board obtained after separating a heap
      ligne - the number of the heap which is the last to have been separated
      resJeu - is the jeuEssai expected after separation
      resLigne - is the expected number of the heap that is separated
